page.title: 02Preston
page.content: The village of Preston has spread out from the church of St.Andrew near to the A353 road. A row of old cottages still stands adjacent to the church but much more noticeable are the modern houses built during the last two years. The village school is also near the church as are the few local shops. Apart from the church the oldest part of the village is around the Bridge Inn. The bridge is one over the River Jordan. The Village mill was near here and traces can still be seen of the mill pond and race. The river can be followed to the sea at Bowleaze Cove. On either side of the river are caravan sites. It has been said that there are more caravans in Preston than anywhere else in Britain.
